title_sort: van doran stafford to walt whitman, 28 may 1882
title: Van Doran Stafford to Walt Whitman, 28 May 1882
text: New YorkMay 28th, 1882Dear WaltI thought I would write a few lines to let you know how I am a getting along & how I like the Steam Boat. I like it middling well but cant tell much about it yet. We expect to take a trip to New Berg on Tuesday next. Perhaps I can tell you more about it after we start. (I have had a verryvery good time Uncle VandoranVan Doran and I isare getting ready to go out to Central Park this after noon for tomorrow we have got to go to work and wontwon't be apt to get anetheranother chance to go soon. I have received totwo letters from home. theyThey say they are all well & Ruth says she will have a situation for me when iI get home to scrub and wash dishes when she rote[wrote] to me she wanted to know if I had to scrub.I have roderidden all around New York on the elevated Rail Way & have seen grand times. We dontdon't know weatherwhether the Boat will run up to long Branch or not they will try at new burg firsfirst & if it pay they will continue on all Summer. You must come on to New York this summer and take a trip with us, that is if I stay here. You must excuse m[my] writing & spelling for I am in a hurry to get off to the park.Write Soon and let me know how you areI will try & write a little more abouabout thing next timeI write & send my love to you, hopeing to herr[hear] from you Soon,VanDirections439 East 23rd stSteamer (PlymothPlymouth) RockNew YorkFrom your friend.Van[fro]m Van Stafford New York May 29 '82 Van Doran Stafford to Walt Whitman, 28 May 1882
